intro: Coccoloba sagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf coral tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and resemble an arrowhead shape. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually pink or white, followed by red, fleshy berries. The plant is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
